div.div: This search form uses an instant search feature. As you type, search results will appear automatically below the search field. When you've entered you desired search terms use tab to navigate through the available results and hit enter to open the selected page or document.

div.h2: Welcome to Mason County Central Schools

h2.a: On line Learning for students-click here

div.p: April is Autism Awareness Month. While we are not together physically, we can still raise awareness through action, thought and praise, for all the beautiful and unique people and families touched by autism. Your courage, patience, and advocacy continues to be influential in bridging gaps of misunderstanding and in providing hope and opportunity.

Let's band together tomorrow, wear something blue, and if you choose... post a pic on your personal social media. This might be an enjoyable way to show pride and support for all those touched by autism......Spartan Style!

The MCC "Landing Page" for our Online students will Launch Thursday morning. A link for that Landing Page is in the Newsfeed under "Remote Learning Plan... April 23." And for those that have been identified as needing instructional packets, they will be distributed at the Distribution Hubs and Schedule that you can find in the same section of the Newsfeed. Watch for more information coming from the Building Principals this Monday. Have a Safe and Healthy Weekend.

Over 24,000 meals prepared and delivered to date for our community's kids. Prepared by 4 of the most dedicated and hard working food service staff and delivered by our transportation department in our "yellow limousines." So proud to be a SPARTAN... and so proud of these great MCC family members.
MCC Campus Drone Video created and shared by George Petersen, one of MCC's valued substitute teachers.
